subject: AI & Agents
title: Reinforcement Learning: Trial and Error
description: A micro-lesson that makes Reinforcement Learning: Trial and Error usable.

hook.text: A toddler touches a hot stove once and never does it again. That's reinforcement learning.

buildup.text: An AI agent takes actions, gets rewards or penalties, and adjusts its strategy.

discovery.text: Over thousands of attempts, it learns which actions lead to the best outcomes.

twist.text: DeepMind's AlphaGo used reinforcement learning to discover moves no human ever played.

climax.text: It's how robots learn to walk, drones learn to fly, and ads learn to target you.

quiz.question: What drives learning in reinforcement learning?
